item.title: 美国连续申请失业救济人数升至 2021 年 11 月以来最高点
item.description: 美国失业救济金的经常性申请人数升至2021年11月以来的最高点，这进一步表明失业人员重新就业变得更加困难。【原文：Recurring applications for US unemployment benefits rose to the highest since November 2021, adding to signs it’s proving more difficult for out-of-work people to reenter the workforce.】

item.title: 价格和产量下降导致俄罗斯石油税收下滑
item.description: 由于产量下降和全球原油价格下跌，俄罗斯上个月从石油税中获得的收入减少了。【原文：Russia reaped less money from oil taxes last month as production fell and global crude prices declined.】

item.title: 美国贸易逆差因出口增长而缩小，进口仍保持高位
item.description: 美国 2 月份的贸易赤字较年初创下的纪录有所减少，原因是强劲的出口缓解了在特朗普政府全面征收关税之前抢购商品和材料的影响。【原文：The US trade deficit shrank in February from a record at the start of the year as stronger exports blunted the impact of a rush to secure goods and materials before the Trump administration’s sweeping tariffs.】

item.title: 高盛称德国财政刺激将改变电力需求的游戏规则
item.description: 据高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Germany’s ambitious plans to ramp up defense and infrastructure spending will drive “major pivot” in power demand during the next few years, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 特朗普给中国习近平一个机会，让他赢得受关税冲击的世界
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普决定提高对几乎所有国家的关税，这将对中国经济造成打击。但这也给了习近平一个难得的机会来全面深化关系，包括与美国在亚洲和其他地区的主要盟友的关系。【原文：Donald Trump’s decision to boost tariffs on almost every country will deal a blow to China’s economy. But it’s also handing Xi Jinping a rare opening to deepen relationships across the board, including with key US allies in Asia and beyond.】

item.title: 特朗普关税将使美股损失近 2 万亿美元
item.description: 由于担心唐纳德-特朗普总统新一轮的全面关税措施可能会使经济陷入衰退，周四开盘时，S&P 500 指数将减少约 1.7 万亿美元。【原文：Roughly $1.7 trillion is set to be erased from the S&P 500 Index when trading opens Thursday amid worries that President Donald Trump’s sweeping new round of tariffs could plunge the economy into a recession.】

item.title: Verizon 推出新福利在紧张市场中争取用户
item.description: Verizon Communications Inc. 承诺提供三年价格保证和免费电话以旧换新服务，作为其最新产品的一部分，旨在吸引新客户，并在竞争激烈的无线市场上留住现有客户。【原文：Verizon Communications Inc. is promising a three-year price guarantee and a free phone trade-in as part of its latest offerings, designed to lure new customers and keep existing ones in a fiercely competitive wireless market.】

item.title: 股价暴跌，杰克-多西的区块链公司进军银行业
item.description: 近十年来，Cai Haun 一直是 Cash App 的忠实用户。她先是用 Block Inc. 的应用程序来存储以前当咖啡师时赚到的小费，现在则用来收发朋友寄来的酒钱和集体聚餐的钱。【原文：Cai Haun has been a loyal Cash App user for nearly a decade. First using Block Inc.’s app as a place to squirrel away tips from her previous job as a barista, and now to send and receive money from friends for drinks and group dinners.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员认为 4 月份可选择降息或暂停降息
item.description: 根据欧洲中央银行 3 月份会议的记录，该行官员认为下一次制定政策时，要么再次降息，要么按兵不动。【原文：European Central Bank officials saw either another reduction in interest rates or a hold as possible when they next set policy, according to an account of their March meeting.】

item.title: TikTok 因向中国发送欧盟数据面临 5 亿多欧元罚款
item.description: TikTok 的所有者字节跳动有限公司（ByteDance Ltd.）因将欧洲用户的数据非法运送到中国，将被处以超过 5 亿欧元（约合 5.53 亿美元）的隐私保护罚款，这加剧了全球对该视频共享应用程序日益强烈的反感。【原文：TikTok owner ByteDance Ltd. is set to be hit by a privacy fine of more than €500 million ($553 million) for illegally shipping European users’ data to China, adding to the growing global backlash over the video-sharing app.】

item.title: 石油免受特朗普关税影响仍将使价格飙升
item.description:
亚洲是需求增长的中心，因此该地区经济不可避免的放缓将产生巨大影响。【原文：

Asia is the center of demand growth, so the inevitable slowdown in the region’s economies will have an outsize impact.

】

item.title: 破获特拉菲古拉公司的瑞士总检察长希望获得美国式权力
item.description: 瑞士最高检察官呼吁立法者赋予他美国式的广泛权力和更多的调查人员，以便更快地对违法公司绳之以法。【原文：Switzerland’s top prosecutor has called on legislators to give him sweeping US-style powers and more investigators to dole out faster justice to errant companies.】

item.title: 欧佩克+加速增加供应，油价跌势加剧
item.description: 欧佩克+同意在 5 月份增加石油供应，增幅超过预期，加深了唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税所引发的油价下滑。【原文：OPEC+ agreed to make a larger than expected oil supply hike in May, deepening the slump in oil prices triggered by President Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: 马斯克的 "DOGE 支出斧头 "悬在科技股头上
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）削减 1 万亿美元联邦支出的努力为饱受打击的科技投资者增添了另一个风险，有可能使这个本已岌岌可危的行业失去数十亿美元的收入。【原文：Elon Musk’s efforts to slash $1 trillion in federal spending adds another risk for battered tech investors, threatening to sap billions in revenue from an already precarious sector.】

item.title: 伯恩斯坦联盟买入土耳其主权美元债券跌势
item.description: AllianceBernstein Holding LP 增持了土耳其硬通货债券，称近期政治动荡造成的疲软是一个买入机会。【原文：AllianceBernstein Holding LP increased its exposure to Turkey’s hard-currency bonds, saying recent weakness on political turmoil is a buying opportunity.】

item.title: 中国在台下静静等待，特朗普却为嘀嗒交易运筹帷幄
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，库尔特-瓦格纳（Kurt Wagner）将探讨美国禁止或出售 TikTok 的最后期限— 再次— 迫在眉睫的问题。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kurt Wagner looks at the looming deadline — again — for a US ban-or-sale of TikTok.】

item.title: 特朗普新关税政策危及欧洲经济增长
item.description: 经济学家们仍在努力了解美国关税将对全球造成多大伤害。在欧洲，迄今得出的主要结论是，由于出口受到打击，企业和家庭面临不确定性，刚刚起步的经济复苏面临严重风险。【原文：Economists are still trying to get a handle on how much harm the US tariffs will do around the world. In Europe, the main takeaway so far is that the fledgling economic recovery is at serious risk from the hit to exports and the uncertainty faced by companies and households.】

item.title: 特朗普关税方案引发世界经济和市场动荡
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿资深编辑。今天我们关注华盛顿的新互惠关税。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, a senior editor in Boston. item.title: 德意志银行警告美元面临广泛 "信心危机 "风险
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）称，如果唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战导致投资者抛售过去十年积累的美国资产，美元将面临信心危机的风险。【原文：The dollar is at risk of a confidence crisis if President Donald Trump’s trade war leads investors to dump US assets accumulated over the past decade, according to Deutsche Bank AG.】

item.title: ASML 首席执行官称美国关税冲击下的全球紧张局势有损创新
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收巨额关税并承诺将扰乱全球贸易流动的前一天，半导体制造领域最先进机器的唯一生产商ASML控股公司（ASML Holding NV）表示，地缘政治紧张局势正在损害创新。【原文：ASML Holding NV, the sole producer of the most advanced machines used in semiconductor manufacturing, said geopolitical tensions are harming innovation a day after US President Donald Trump levied massive tariffs that promise to disrupt trade flows across the entire world.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）将在春季会议上审议肯尼亚的新项目申请
item.description: 据贷款方称，国际货币基金组织和肯尼亚将在本月晚些时候举行的年度会议上讨论新计划的谈判框架。【原文：The International Monetary Fund and Kenya will discuss the framework for talks over a new program during the annual meetings later this month, according to the lender.】

item.title: 美国股市在关税引发的大跌中首当其冲
item.description: 市场数据截至美国东部时间上午 06:08。根据供应商协议，市场数据可能会有所延迟。【原文：Market data as of 06:08 am EST. Market data may be delayed depending on provider agreements.】

item.title: 以色列与特朗普关系密切，却未能免受高关税之苦
item.description: 如果本雅明-内塔尼亚胡认为他与唐纳德-特朗普的亲密关系会使以色列免受美国高关税的影响，那他就错了。【原文：If Benjamin Netanyahu thought his closeness to Donald Trump would spare Israel from high US tariffs, he was wrong.】

item.title: 开曼群岛斥资 740 亿美元打造保险枢纽，阿波罗对此表示不满
item.description: 穿着粉色 Polo 衫、戴着太阳镜的一小群人登上了双体船，准备在加勒比蓝宝石般的海水上度过一个下午。他们的饮料下夹着一张餐巾纸，上面印着一句类似搭讪的口号："让我们超越商务闲聊......"让我们超越商务闲聊......"【原文：The small crowd in pastel polo shirts and sunglasses boarded the catamaran for an afternoon cruise on the Caribbean’s sapphire waters. Tucked under their drinks were napkins emblazoned with a slogan akin to a pickup line: “Let’s go beyond business small talk...”】

item.title: 绿色登场后，中国将实现离岸债券发行多元化
item.description: 在首次发行的绿色债券受到大量追捧后，中国正寻求使其离岸债务项目多样化，并更有规律地进行销售，以吸引国际投资者。【原文：China is looking to diversify its offshore debt program and make sales more regularly to tap international investors, following hefty demand for its debut green bonds.】

item.title: 微软将数据中心从芝加哥撤回雅加达
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp. ）在全球范围内的数据中心项目有所缩减，这表明该公司正在重新审视其建设为人工智能和云计算提供动力的服务器群的计划。【原文：Microsoft Corp. has pulled back on data center projects around the world, suggesting the company is taking a harder look at its plans to build the server farms powering artificial intelligence and the cloud.】

item.title: 英国通胀预期持续升温令英国央行头疼不已
item.description: 尽管有迹象表明劳动力市场正在缓慢降温，但第一季度英国企业的工资和通胀预期仍顽固地维持在较高水平。【原文：UK businesses’ wage and inflation expectations held at stubbornly elevated levels in the first quarter despite signs that the labor market is slowly cooling.】

item.title: 新加坡不会报复美国关税，而是寻求与美国接触
item.description: 新加坡副总理颜金勇排除了在美国征收 10%的全球基准关税后立即采取任何报复行动的可能性，并表示官员们将就可能对新加坡经济造成 "重大影响 "的征税问题寻求谈判。【原文：Singapore Deputy Prime Minister Gan Kim Yong ruled out any immediate retaliation after the US imposed a 10% baseline global tariff, indicating officials will seek talks over levies which threaten to have a “significant impact” on the city-state’s economy.】

item.title: 对冲基金为特朗普关税做好准备，3 月出现历史性大跌
item.description: 至少有一类投资者已经为唐纳德-特朗普总统周三宣布的关税做好了准备：对冲基金，它们以创纪录的速度抛售股票。【原文：At least one group of investors was ready for President Donald Trump’s Wednesday tariff announcement: hedge funds, which offloaded equities at a record pace.】

item.title: 黄金运往美国的热潮因关税豁免而戛然而止
item.description: 随着周三唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布贵金属将免于征收全面关税，将价值数百亿美元的黄金和白银引向美国的大规模套利贸易戛然而止。【原文：A massive arbitrage trade that has drawn tens of billions of dollars’ worth of gold and silver to the US came to an abrupt halt with Wednesday’s announcement that precious metals would be exempt from Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs.】
